description.narrative: Cocoa Livelihoods Improvement Program aims to improve the productivity and resilience of the crop through training farmers and extension officers in modern plant husbandry which significantly increases tree productivity and improves crop resilience against pests and disease; training in improved on-farm quality control for fermenting and drying beans; rehabilitating old trees planted during the colonial and early independence period that had fallen into disuse; subsidy support to eligible farmers for the purchase of pruning, drying and fermenting equipment; support for quarantine services in training and monitoring in relation to cocoa pod borer; building a more integrated industry approach through the formation of a National Cocoa Steering Committee comprising government and the private sector; and, working with private sector groups to improve quality control and marketing. The Cocoa project provides support to farmers in five of the nine provinces. The total value of this initiative
